item.title: Michelle add a quote by Nick Hornby
Michelle add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Michelle add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Do you think I am an automaton? — a machine without feelings? and can bear to have my morsel of bread snatched from my lips, and my drop of living water dashed from my cup? Do you think, because I am poor, obscure, plain, and little, I am soulless and heartless? You think wrong! — I have as much soul as you — and full as much heart! And if God had gifted me with some beauty and much wealth, I should have made it as hard for you to leave me, as it is now for me to leave you. I am not talking to you now through the medium of custom, conventionalities, nor even of mortal flesh: it is my spirit that addresses your spirit; just as if both had passed through the grave, and we stood at God's feet, equal — as we are!" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "Memory is a snare, pure and simple; it alters, it subtly rearranges the past to fit the present." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "If you're afraid of butter, use cream." -- Julia Child

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Harriet Van Horne
item.description: "Cooking is like love; it should be entered into with abandon or not at all." -- Harriet Van Horne

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "I think every woman should have a blowtorch." -- Julia Child

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Julia Child
Michelle add a quote by julia child
item.description: "...small helpings, no seconds, no snacking, and a little bit of everything. - Julia Child" -- julia child

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen
